data.title: LangGraph Prebuilt Computer Use Agent for OpenAI | Brace Sproul ...
data.snippet: reflect real improvements or random variation ‚Ä¢ Backed by ùó≥ùó≤ùòÉ, a lightweight Python library for reproducible & extensible benchmarking üèÜ Leaderboard:  üìù Paper:  üíª GitHub: [...] üöÄ Exciting Update: I just built a Movie Recommendation System using the MovieLens 100K dataset! üé¨üçø TASK 3 The project applies Collaborative Filtering and evaluates performance with Precision@K to recommend unseen movies for users. Elevvo Pathways üîç Key Highlights ‚úÖ User-Based Collaborative Filtering (recommendations from similar users) ‚úÖ Evaluation using Precision@5 ‚úÖ Data visualizations for insights üî• Bonus Implementations ‚ú® Item-Based Collaborative Filtering (movie-to-movie similarity) ‚ú® Matrix Factorization (SVD) to capture hidden patterns üí° This project strengthened my skills in: Python, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn Similarity-based modeling & recommendation systems Data visualization and model evaluation Here‚Äôs a quick glimpse of the results: üé• Different methods recommend different [...] üíØ Day 16 / 100 ‚Äì 100 Days of #LeetCode Challenge üîç Problem: Implement strStr() Goal: Return the index of the first occurrence of the substring needle inside haystack. If needle is not found, return -1. My Approach (Manual Sliding Window): First, check if needle is even present‚Äîif not, return -1 immediately. Loop through each position i of haystack. For each position, compare the slice haystack[i : i + len(needle)] with needle. If they match, return the current index i. Complexity: ‚è± Time: O((n ‚àí m + 1) \ m) ‚Äì n = length of haystack, m = length of needle. üóÇ Space: O(1) ‚Äì only variables for indexing are used. Key Takeaways: A simple sliding window solution is easy to understand and sufficient for most inputs. For very large strings, advanced algorithms like KMP can reduce worst-case time.

data.title: Introducing Open Source Deep Research Agent - LinkedIn
data.snippet:
# Introducing Open Source Deep Research Agent

This title was summarized by AI from the post below.

Brace Sproul

 Report this post

OPEN DEEP RESEARCH!!! We're extremely excited to release our open source deep research agent! This agent excels at high quality research and report generation over not only web searches, but also internal data sources!! Along with the repo, we've also released a blog post diving into the architecture, design decisions, and lessons we learned while building it. Check out the repo, blog, YouTube video, and demo on Open Agent Platform today: OSS Repo:  Blog:  Video:  Open Agent Platform demo:
